provisions.title: Affirmative Express Consent
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from disclosing any consumer's Covered Information to any Outside Party without first obtaining that consumer's Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations Related to Negative Options
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from misrepresenting any material aspect of its Negative Option Feature offers, including cancellation terms, costs, free-trial claims, billing authorization, and refund or cancellation policies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Cooperation with Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide Assessors with all relevant information and materials and must not misrepresent any material facts to the Assessor in connection with any mandated Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Annual Certifications
provisions.summary: Defendant must annually provide the FTC with a certification from a senior corporate manager confirming that the Program has been established and maintained, that there is no uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing any Covered Incidents during the period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Defendant must report each Covered Incident to the Assessor and FTC within 30 days of discovery, with updates every 30 days until fully resolved, and publish a public version of the report on its websites and apps within 45 days of verification.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Notice to Users
provisions.summary: Within 14 days of the Order, Defendant must post a prescribed Notice on its websites and apps and email it to all consumers who provided Covered Information between October 2019 and March 1, 2023, keeping the Notice in place for two years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits and Deletion of Covered Information and Data Product
provisions.summary: Defendant must document a retention schedule within 7 days, delete all Covered Information not used for Treatment, Payment, or Health Care Operations within 60 days, provide a consumer deletion request mechanism within 60 days, identify all third-party recipients within 30 days, and instruct those third parties to delete Covered Information within 60 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Required Disclosures Relating to Negative Option Feature
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from promoting any Negative Option Feature without making specific Clear and Conspicuous disclosures about costs, affirmative action required to avoid charges, recurring charge deadlines, and cancellation mechanisms; and must send written transaction confirmations to consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Simple Mechanism to Cancel Negative Option Feature
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide consumers with a simple, easy-to-find, and easy-to-use cancellation mechanism that does not require unnecessary steps or use Dark Patterns, available through the same channel (Internet, phone, or mail) through which the consumer enrolled.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Monetary Judgments for Monetary Relief and Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant is ordered to pay $5,087,252.89 as monetary relief and $10,000,000 as a civil penalty, with $2,000,000 of the civil penalty paid immediately (the remainder suspended based on Defendant's financial representations) and the monetary relief paid within 7 days of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, the Complaint's facts may be taken as true in future proceedings, and monetary relief funds may be used for consumer redress or, if impracticable, for related relief or deposited into the U.S. Treasury as an additional civil penalty.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Independent Redress Administrator
provisions.summary: If the FTC determines redress is practicable, an independent redress administrator will be appointed; Defendant must provide Eligible Customer information within 7 days of notification, cooperate fully with the Administrator, and pay all Administrator costs and fees.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies of the Order to all relevant personnel and businesses within 7 days (or before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's entry and submit sworn compliance notices within 14 days of any change in points of contact or corporate structure for 20 years; all submissions must be made to the FTC via email or overnight courier.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain for 5 years (over a 20-year period) accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, all compliance records, and copies of all marketing materials related to health services and Negative Option Feature products.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through compliance reports, depositions, document production, and direct communications with Defendant and its employees; Defendant must comply with written requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with Plaintiff and the Commission in this case and any related investigation, providing truthful and complete information and causing its personnel to appear for proceedings upon 5 days' written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must maintain and make available to the FTC copies of compliance-related documents: documents contradicting compliance for five years, and all plans, reports, and assessments related to biennial assessment periods for three years after each assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Order Delivery and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondents must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with supervisory responsibilities relating to the subject matter of the order, within 30 days of service or assumption of responsibilities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Notice of Business Changes — Christopher M. Likens
provisions.summary: For ten years after issuance, Christopher M. Likens must notify the FTC by certified mail of any discontinuance of his current business or employment, or affiliation with any new business or employment providing financial products or services, including address, phone, and description of duties.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Notice of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondents must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change (dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, name or address change, etc.) that may affect compliance obligations; if less than 30 days' notice is possible, notification must be as soon as practicable.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days after service of this order, and at such other times as the FTC may require, detailing the manner and form of compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order terminates on June 19, 2026, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a federal court complaint alleging a violation of the order, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC compliance-related documents for five years and all materials relied upon to prepare each assessment for three years after preparation of that assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future subsidiaries, principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, within sixty days of service or assumption of such role.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Compliance Notification of Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least thirty days prior to any change that may affect its compliance obligations, such as dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or name/address change, with expedited notice if less than thirty days' advance knowledge.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from misrepresenting, or assisting others in misrepresenting, key facts about their business including location, product qualities, warranties, pricing, compliance program membership, and cancellation/refund policies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Ban on Use of Foreign Website Designations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from selling goods over the Internet using any website domain name, extension, or suffix associated with a country other than the United States, unless actually located and doing business in that foreign country.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Ban on Credit or Debit Card Charges Before Readiness to Ship
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from charging consumer credit cards, debit cards, gift cards, or bank accounts for goods until they have actually obtained the goods and are ready to ship them.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Compliance with Mail Order Rule
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from violating any provision of the Mail Order Rule, including specific requirements around shipping time disclosures, delay options, revised shipping dates, renewed delay options, cancellation notices, and prompt refunds.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Customer Chargebacks
provisions.summary: Defendants must not oppose or contest customer chargebacks made prior to twelve months from the date of entry of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Defendants are ordered to pay $500,000 in equitable monetary relief to the Commission, with payment suspended subject to the provisions of Section VII.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Right to Reopen / Suspension of Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: The $500,000 monetary judgment suspension is premised on the truthfulness of Defendants' financial statements; if material misrepresentation is found, the suspension is lifted and the full amount becomes due. Funds paid go toward consumer redress, with any remainder deposited in the U.S. Treasury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, facility inspections, undercover investigations, and employee interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For four years from entry of the Order, Defendants must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, business structure, and name; file sworn annual compliance reports starting 60 days after entry; and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days.

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.summary: For four years from entry, Defendants must deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, employees, and agents; new personnel must receive copies before assuming responsibilities; and all recipients must sign and date an acknowledgment of receipt within 30 days of delivery.

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days of receipt.

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $800,000 for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities - FCRA
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act, including prohibitions on furnishing consumer reports without permissible purpose and requirements to maintain reasonable procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities - Section 5 (Endorsements)
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from misrepresenting the status of users or endorsers and must disclose material connections between endorsers and the company.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit acknowledgments of receipt of the Order and deliver copies to personnel and related entities for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit compliance reports to the Commission, including an initial report after one year and ongoing notices of changes for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain specified records for 20 years after entry of the Order, with each record retained for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through various means including document requests, depositions, interviews, and posing as consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Practices – FCRA Section 609(e) Record Disclosure
provisions.summary: Defendant and its agents are permanently enjoined from failing to timely provide identity theft victims with copies of application and business transaction records within 30 days of a valid written request under FCRA Section 609(e), subject to identity verification requirements and enumerated exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: A civil penalty judgment of $220,000 is entered against Defendant, payable to the U.S. Treasury within 7 days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.title: Notices to Eligible Victims and Other Victims
provisions.summary: Defendant must post a website notice directing identity theft victims on how to request records, and must certify to the Commission that it has sent records and/or notices to Eligible Victims who previously submitted requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order to the Commission within 7 days, deliver copies of the Order to relevant employees and successors for 5 years, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after entry, notify the Commission of structural or contact changes within 14 days for 10 years, and report any bankruptcy filing within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create specified records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, covering revenues, personnel, consumer complaints, requests for records, and all materials demonstrating compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through information requests, depositions, discovery, direct communications, employee interviews, and undercover means, with Defendant required to respond within 14 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 609(e) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(e)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the Commission of structural changes for five years, submit sworn written compliance reports for three years, notify of any bankruptcy filing within fifteen days, and send all reports by overnight courier or first-class mail with electronic copy.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide annual certifications to the Commission for twenty years from a board-level or senior officer attesting to compliance with the Order, absence of material noncompliance, cooperation with the Assessor, and describing any Covered Incidents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.summary: For twenty years, Defendant must report Covered Incidents to the Commission no later than ten days after first notifying any government entity, with detailed information about the incident, and provide quarterly summaries to its board.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment and Additional Monetary Obligations
provisions.summary: A monetary judgment of $425,000,000 is entered against Defendant, with additional financial obligations triggered if more than seven million Affected Consumers enroll in the Product, calculated using specified formulas during both the Initial and Extended Claims Periods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Consumer Restitution and Redress Through Multi-District Litigation
provisions.summary: Consumer relief may be conducted through the Multi-District Litigation Settlement rather than directly by the Commission, with Defendant required to deposit $300,000,000 into the Consumer Fund in specified tranches and up to an additional $125,000,000 if needed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Consumer Fund for Multi-District Litigation
provisions.summary: At least $300,000,000 (plus any additional deposits) in the Consumer Fund must be used exclusively to provide restitution and redress to Affected Consumers through specified categories of relief including credit monitoring, out-of-pocket loss reimbursement, identity restoration services, and administrative costs.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Notice and Claims in Multi-District Litigation
provisions.summary: If Defendant deposits money into the Consumer Fund, it must supply information to the Notice Provider and Settlement Administrator, notify the Commission of any modifications, provide weekly and annual reports to the Commission, and cooperate fully in claims administration.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Reversion of Consumer Relief to Administration by Commission
provisions.summary: The Commission may end its forbearance and collect the monetary judgment directly upon written notice of specified Termination Events, at which point Defendant must make direct payments to the Commission within twenty-one days and continue to cooperate in consumer relief administration.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to assets transferred under this Order, facts in the Complaint are deemed true for enforcement proceedings, and all money paid to the Commission will be used for consumer relief consistent with Section IX.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.summary: Defendant must not use information provided by Affected Consumers through the Order's identity theft protection services to sell, upsell, cross-sell, or market its products or services unless it makes a Clear and Conspicuous disclosure and obtains affirmative express consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.summary: Defendant must provide specific notices to Affected Consumers and the general public, including website hyperlinks, press releases, and social media posts directing consumers to the Settlement Website, within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within seven days, deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managerial employees, and affected business entities for ten years, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.summary: If any clause, provision, or section of the Order is held illegal, invalid, or unenforceable, the remaining provisions remain in full force and effect.

provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); sections 615 and 621 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681m and 1681s; and the Prescreen Opt-Out Notice Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 642

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $53,000 to the United States within ten business days of entry of the Order, with provisions for default interest and non-dischargeability in bankruptcy.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to provide required FCRA pre-adverse action and post-adverse action notices to consumers, and from otherwise failing to comply with FCRA Sections 604 and 615.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: Defendant must cooperate with FTC monitoring, including submitting reports, producing documents, appearing for deposition, and providing access to business locations upon written notice; the Commission may also use lawful investigative means including undercover posing as a consumer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must notify the FTC of structural changes at least 30 days in advance, file annual written compliance reports (beginning 180 days after entry), notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days, and submit all reports by overnight courier or first-class mail with electronic copy.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry of the Order, Defendant must create and retain specified records relating to FCRA disclosures, consumer complaints, training materials, law enforcement communications, and all documents demonstrating full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For five years from service of the Order, Defendant must deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, managers, relevant employees, and any successor business entities, and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Changes Affecting Compliance
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any change in the company that may affect compliance obligations under the order.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the FTC within 60 days after service of the order and at other times as required by the Commission.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate 20 years from its issuance date or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: FCRA Section 611 Compliance — Dispute Reinvestigation
provisions.summary: Respondent must comply with FCRA Section 611 in connection with collection, preparation, assembly, maintenance, and furnishing of consumer reports and files, including reinvestigating disputed information, notifying furnishers, reviewing consumer submissions, preventing reappearance of deleted information, providing written notice of results, permitting dispute statements, including dispute statements in reports, and providing notifications at consumer request.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681u

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain all business records demonstrating compliance with this order for five years and make them available to the FTC upon request for inspection and copying.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681u

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees and agents, and obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681u

provisions.title: Compliance Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, name change, or bankruptcy filing.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681u

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 60 days of service of this order and at such other times as the FTC may require (within 30 days of such requests).
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681u

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: This order terminates 20 years from the date of issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.company_name: First American Real Estate Solutions, LLC
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681u

provisions.title: Prohibition on Misrepresentations Regarding Loan Payments and Fees
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting payment amounts, fee legitimacy, loan terms, or any loan status information unless substantiated by competent and reliable evidence.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Prohibition on Unauthorized Fees
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from assessing or collecting any fee unless it is for services actually rendered and is expressly authorized by loan instruments, permitted by law, or consented to by the consumer after clear and prominent disclosure.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Restrictions on Property Inspection Fees (5-Year Limitation)
provisions.summary: For five years after entry of the Order, defendants are enjoined from assessing or collecting property inspection fees unless specific delinquency and frequency conditions are met, or inspections are required by law or HUD handbook.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Prohibition on FDCPA Violations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from engaging in harassing, deceptive, or unfair debt collection practices and from failing to provide required debt validation notices, in connection with loans that were in default when obtained by defendants.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Prohibition on FCRA Violations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from failing to report accounts as disputed to consumer reporting agencies when consumers dispute account accuracy, and from any other FCRA non-compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Prohibition on TILA Violations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from failing to make required TILA disclosures before consummating a consumer credit transaction, including loan modifications constituting a refinancing, and from any other TILA/Regulation Z non-compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Data Integrity Program
provisions.summary: Within 90 days of entry of the Order, defendants must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive written data integrity program at EMC to ensure accuracy and completeness of consumer loan account data, including designated oversight, regular testing, and ongoing evaluation and adjustment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Third-Party Data Integrity Assessment
provisions.summary: Defendants must obtain an initial third-party assessment of their data integrity program within 180 days of entry of the Order and biennially thereafter for eight years, and provide the first assessment along with supporting materials to the FTC within 10 days of delivery; subsequent assessments must be retained and provided to the Commission within 10 days of request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Pre-Foreclosure Verification Requirements (8-Year Obligation)
provisions.summary: For eight years after entry of the Order, defendants are enjoined from initiating a foreclosure action or assessing related fees until they have verified the consumer's material default, confirmed no prohibited acts have occurred (or have been remedied), and investigated any consumer disputes; defendants must maintain records documenting these steps.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Monetary Relief — Consumer Redress Payment
provisions.summary: Defendants must jointly and severally pay $28,000,000 to the FTC within five business days of entry of the Order for consumer redress; unpaid amounts accrue interest and defendants bear collection costs in case of default.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Data Provision to Facilitate Redress
provisions.summary: To facilitate consumer redress under Section X, defendants must provide the Commission or its designated agent all information reasonably required to administer redress, including a complete electronic data set in a compatible format, within 30 calendar days of a written request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor defendants' compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, facility inspections, and interviews of personnel; defendants must cooperate within 20 days of written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For five years, defendants must notify the FTC of corporate structure changes at least 30 days in advance; within 180 days of entry of the Order each defendant must submit a sworn written compliance report to the FTC including any required change notifications and copies of acknowledgments of receipt of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry of the Order, defendants must create and retain for at least three years after preparation: accounting records, personnel records, customer files, consumer complaints and responses, training materials and policy manuals, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Order, defendants must deliver a copy of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with supervisory responsibility over the subject matter of the Order, and secure signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: Each defendant must submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Final Judgment and Order
provisions.summary: The parties consent to entry of the Order as a final judgment and order, with each party bearing its own costs and attorneys' fees.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. § 1692 et seq.; Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq.; Truth in Lending Act (TILA) Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. § 226

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Deceptive Collection Practices
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained and enjoined from making any misrepresentation to consumers or third parties in connection with the collection of a debt, including false threats of arrest, overstated legal obligations, and false threats of lawsuits or wage garnishment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unfair Collection Practices
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained and enjoined from engaging in any unfair act or practice in connection with the collection of a debt, including repeatedly calling consumers at work, using abusive language, and disclosing debts to third parties.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violations of the Truth In Lending Act and Regulation Z
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained and enjoined from failing to make required TILA disclosures clearly and conspicuously in writing before consummating consumer credit transactions, and from failing to comply with TILA and Regulation Z in any other manner.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violations of Nevada State Laws
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained and enjoined from violating Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes, including requirements to obtain required licenses, provide notice of material facts, and comply with state and federal statutes governing the sale of goods or services.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Additional Disclosures and Other Requirements
provisions.summary: Defendants must clearly and conspicuously disclose material credit terms before consummating transactions, obtain written confirmation from consumers of receipt of disclosures, and provide written itemizations of amounts paid and due upon consumer request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Employee Monitoring by Defendants
provisions.summary: Defendants must take reasonable steps to monitor and ensure that all employees and independent contractors engaged in extending consumer credit or collecting debts comply with Sections I through V of this Order, including listening to calls, maintaining a customer response center, investigating complaints, and taking corrective action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: Judgment of $1,000,000 is entered jointly and severally against all Defendants, with $970,125.00 paid to the FTC and $29,875.00 to the State of Nevada within 10 days of entry of this Order, to be used for equitable relief including consumer restitution.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor and investigate compliance with this Order by requiring Defendants to submit written reports, produce documents, appear for depositions, provide access to business locations, and by posing as consumers or suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For a period of three years from entry of this Order, Defendants must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, business ownership, and corporate structure, and must file annual sworn compliance reports beginning 180 days after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For a period of six years from entry of this Order, Defendants must create, retain, and secure records relating to consumer credit and debt collection, including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, and all documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For a period of three years from entry of this Order, Corporate Defendants must deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, employees, agents, and representatives; Individual Defendants who control a business must do the same; and all recipients must sign dated acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt of the Order as entered by the Court.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601-1666j

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Second Supplemental Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Costs and Attorney's Fees
provisions.summary: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorney's fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Notice of Entry of Supplemental Order
provisions.summary: Entry of this Second Supplemental Order in the court docket constitutes notice to Defendant of its terms and conditions, and Defendant waives all rights to contest proper service in any future proceeding.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from failing to comply with federal regulations regarding policies and procedures for accuracy and integrity of information furnished to consumer reporting agencies, and from failing to reasonably investigate direct disputes about account information.

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Furnisher Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 660, recodified at 12 C.F.R. § 1022, Subpart E
