provisions.title: Costs and Attorneys' Fees
provisions.summary: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Furnisher Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 660, recodified at 12 C.F.R. § 1022, Subpart E

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment and Partial Suspension
provisions.summary: A judgment of $8,750,000 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally; $828,500 must be paid within 7 days of entry, with additional remittance from a Directors' and Officers' Trust upon its termination; the remainder is suspended subject to conditions regarding truthfulness of financial representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants relinquish all rights to transferred assets, the Complaint's facts are established as true for future proceedings, and money paid may be used by the Commission for equitable relief including consumer redress.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver the Order to key personnel and new hires, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit a sworn compliance report 1 year after entry, provide sworn notices of material changes within 14 days for 20 years, notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and submit all required materials via specified channels.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create specified records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each record for 5 years, covering accounting, personnel, consumer complaints, compliance documentation, and marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission has broad rights to monitor Defendants' compliance, including demanding reports and documents within 14 days, conducting depositions and discovery, communicating directly with Defendants and their personnel, and using undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Cease and Desist – Adverse Action Disclosure Failures
provisions.summary: Aldi must stop failing to disclose to employment applicants, at the time of adverse action, that the denial was based on a consumer report and the name and address of the reporting agency. Aldi must also mail retroactive notices to applicants denied employment between January 1, 1994 and the order date.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a), and Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: For five years from the order's issuance, Aldi must maintain and make available to the FTC upon request documents demonstrating compliance with Part I, including employment evaluation criteria, employee instructions, applicant notices, and records of all applicants for whom consumer reports were obtained but employment was not offered or was withheld.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a), and Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Distribution
provisions.summary: For five years from the order's issuance, Aldi must deliver a copy of this Order at least once per year to all persons responsible for its compliance with Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a), and Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Aldi must notify the FTC at least 30 days before any proposed corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this Order, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address changes, by certified mail to the FTC's Associate Director of Enforcement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a), and Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Within 60 days of service of this Order, and at such other times as the FTC may require, Aldi must file a written compliance report with the Commission detailing how it has complied with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a), and Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: This Order terminates on September 5, 2017, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a federal court complaint alleging a violation of the Order, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a), and Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Injunction Against False or Misleading Statements
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from making any false or misleading representations in connection with advertising, promoting, or selling any credit-related products or services.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violating Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from violating or assisting any person in violating Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, including inducing consumers to divulge personal financial information through false representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Redress and Other Equitable Relief from the Canadian Defendants
provisions.summary: Judgment of $9,066,434 is entered jointly and severally against the Canadian Defendants; they must pay $405,589.50 to the Commission within five business days of entry of the Order, with the remainder suspended upon timely payment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Right to Enforce Suspended Judgment Against the Canadian Defendants
provisions.summary: The Commission's agreement to suspend judgment is premised on the accuracy of the Canadian Defendants' sworn financial statements; if misrepresentation is found, the full $9,066,434 judgment becomes immediately due.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Redress and Other Equitable Relief from the Florida Defendants
provisions.summary: Judgment of $9,066,434 is entered jointly and severally against the Florida Defendants; they must pay $9,600 to the Commission within five business days of entry of the Order, with the remainder suspended upon timely payment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Right to Enforce Suspended Judgment Against the Florida Defendants
provisions.summary: The Commission's agreement to suspend judgment is premised on the accuracy of the Florida Defendants' sworn financial statements; if misrepresentation is found, the full $9,066,434 judgment becomes immediately due.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Lifting of Asset Freeze
provisions.summary: The asset freeze against all Defendants is lifted solely for the purpose of transferring funds to the FTC pursuant to the judgment paragraphs, and is dissolved upon transfer of all such funds.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Transfer of Customer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from selling, renting, leasing, transferring, or disclosing identifying information of any person who paid money to any Defendant for any credit-related product, program, or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: All Defendants must submit a sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Order, all Defendants must distribute copies of the Order to principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendants
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Order, Defendants must notify the Commission of changes in residence, employment, and corporate structure, and must file a sworn written compliance report 180 days after entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry of the Order, all Defendants must create and retain specified business records including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, and compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Authority to Monitor Compliance
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor compliance by all lawful means; Defendants must submit additional reports, produce documents, appear for deposition, and provide access to business locations within ten days of written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Fees and Costs
provisions.summary: Each party to this Order agrees to bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction and Entry of Judgment
provisions.summary: This Court retains jurisdiction of this matter to apply for further orders and directives, to enforce compliance, or to punish violations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Complete Settlement
provisions.summary: The FTC and Defendants consent to entry of the foregoing Order as a final judgment and full, complete, and final settlement of this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendants must pay a civil penalty of $1,200,000 to the United States in installments, secured by liens on real property.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a), Section 5(n), Section 13(b), and Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(n), 53(b), and 56(a); and sections 604(f), 607(e)(1), 607(e)(2), 615(d)(3), and 621 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b(f), 1681e(e)(1), 1681e(e)(2), 1681m(d)(3), and 1681s

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through requests for reports and documents, depositions, direct communications, employee interviews, and lawful undercover means, including compulsory process.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Permanent Injunction — Continuation
provisions.summary: The original Permanent Injunction remains in full force and effect, except that Sections VI through IX are replaced by Sections V through VIII of this Amended Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment and Consumer Redress
provisions.summary: A judgment of $100,000,000 is entered against LifeLock; LifeLock must deposit the full amount into the Court's Registry within five business days and satisfy all related obligations governing disbursement, crediting, and remittance to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: LifeLock must provide customer information requested by the Commission to facilitate consumer redress, including responding to written requests within 10 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Entry of Order
provisions.summary: The court finds no just reason for delay and directs the clerk to enter the Order immediately.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For five years, LifeLock must notify the Commission of corporate changes at least 30 days in advance, file annual sworn compliance reports, and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor LifeLock's compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, site inspections, undercover investigations, and employee interviews, using all lawful means including civil discovery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: LifeLock must create and retain specified categories of records for defined periods: 13 years from the Permanent Injunction for business and compliance records, 3 years for biennial assessment materials, and 5 years from this Order for consumer redress payment records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For five years, LifeLock must deliver copies of the Permanent Injunction and this Order to principals, officers, relevant employees, agents, and successor entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Acknowledgement of Receipt of This Order
provisions.summary: LifeLock must submit a sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receiving it.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for all purposes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from failing to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy in Background Screening Reports and from failing to disclose sources of information in a Consumer's File upon consumer request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Affirmative Requirements
provisions.summary: Defendants must implement written procedures to prevent inclusion of inaccurate or improper records in Background Screening Reports, monitor dispute data, maintain a compliance committee, and retain Frequency Reports.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Consumer's File Disclosures
provisions.summary: Defendant TransUnion Rental Screening Solutions, Inc. must provide consumers, upon request and at no charge, all information in their Consumer's File, including all information that might be provided to a customer or end user.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Adverse Action Template
provisions.summary: Defendant TransUnion Rental Screening Solutions, Inc. must make available to customers a written Adverse Action notice template consistent with FCRA requirements, including prompts to attach the Consumer Report and state reasons for the Adverse Action, and must post it publicly on its websites.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order to Pay Redress
provisions.summary: Defendants must reserve $11,000,000 for consumer redress, submit a Bureau-approved Redress Plan within 60 days, compensate Affected Consumers on a pro rata basis, and remit any unused funds to the Bureau.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order to Pay Civil Money Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendants must pay a $4,000,000 civil money penalty to the Bureau within 10 days of entry of this Order, and may not claim tax benefits or seek reimbursement for the penalty.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Covers interest accrual on default, relinquishment of funds, collateral estoppel effect of the Complaint's facts, Taxpayer Identification Number use, and notification requirements upon Related Consumer Actions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Defendants must fully cooperate with the Bureau to identify Affected Consumers and the amount of their injury, providing requested information within 14 days of a written request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit sworn acknowledgments of receipt of this Order, deliver copies to current and future relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from recipients.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must make timely submissions to the FTC and Bureau, including initial contact and business information within 7 days, a list of Order recipients at 90 days, an annual compliance report, ongoing notices of structural or operational changes for 5 years, bankruptcy filings within 14 days, quarterly redress payment reports, and sworn declarations for all submissions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants must create and retain for 5 years specified records relating to Background Screening Reports, including accounting records, personnel records, complaints, training materials, and all records necessary to demonstrate compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC and Bureau have the right to monitor Defendants' compliance by requesting additional reports, communicating directly with Defendants, interviewing employees, and using compulsory legal process.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a)(1) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1)

provisions.title: Fair Credit Reporting Act Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants must establish and maintain a comprehensive monitoring program to assess whether they are operating as a Consumer Reporting Agency and to prevent prohibited business activities before advertising or selling any Covered Report.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants are permanently enjoined from failing to comply with key FCRA requirements when operating as a Consumer Reporting Agency, including maintaining proper procedures, ensuring accuracy, providing required notices, and conducting reinvestigations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations to Consumers Regarding Covered Reports
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants are permanently enjoined from making any misrepresentations, expressly or by implication, about Covered Reports, including misrepresentations about the effect of removal mechanisms, the probability of Covered Records existing, accuracy, whether traffic tickets are criminal records, or any other facts about Covered Records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Concerning Misrepresentations in Violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants are permanently enjoined from making or assisting in any misrepresentation about what a user can achieve with a product or service, or about the status of any reviewer or endorser, including misrepresentations that a reviewer is an unbiased or ordinary user.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Required Disclosures of Unexpected Material Connections
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants are permanently enjoined from making any representation about any reviewer or endorser of a Covered Report or related good or service without Clearly and Conspicuously disclosing, in Close Proximity to that representation, any Unexpected Material Connection between the reviewer or endorser and the Settling Defendants or affiliated entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Monitoring of Endorsers
provisions.summary: Within 90 days of entry of the order, Settling Defendants must implement steps to ensure compliance with endorser disclosure requirements, including providing clear disclosure statements to each reviewer, obtaining signed acknowledgments, establishing a monitoring system for endorser representations, contacting non-compliant endorsers, and creating monitoring reports.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Judgment of $5,800,000 is entered jointly and severally against the Settling Defendants as a civil penalty, to be paid to the U.S. Treasury within 7 days of entry of the order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants relinquish all rights to transferred assets and must submit their Taxpayer Identification Numbers to the Commission for use in collecting any delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants must fully cooperate with FTC representatives in this case and related investigations, providing truthful information and making officers, employees, and agents available for interviews and proceedings upon 5 days' written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Each Settling Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the order within 7 days, deliver copies to all principals, managerial employees, and agents within 7 days (or before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants must submit an initial compliance report one year after entry of the order, provide sworn notices within 14 days of any structural or contact changes for 15 years, and notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filings. All submissions must be sworn under penalty of perjury and sent to the FTC's designated address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Settling Defendants must create certain records for 15 years after entry of the order and retain each record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, marketing materials, training materials, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Settling Defendants' compliance through additional reports, depositions, document production, and direct communication with employees; Settling Defendants must respond within 14 days to written requests and permit employee interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement of this Stipulated Order, with the Honorable Michael S. Berg, United States Magistrate Judge, retaining continuing and exclusive jurisdiction over all parties and matters relating to the litigation and settlement agreement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: PLS and PLS-Illinois must pay a civil penalty of $101,500 to the U.S. Treasury for violations of the FCRA.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violating FCRA Disposal Rule
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from violating the FCRA Disposal Rule, including failing to properly dispose of consumer information by taking reasonable measures to protect against unauthorized access.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit acknowledgments of receipt of the Order to the FTC and deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel and entities, obtaining signed acknowledgments from recipients.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Annual Compliance Report
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit a comprehensive annual compliance report one year after entry of the Order, detailing contact information, business activities, and compliance with each section of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Compliance Notice for Changes
provisions.summary: Defendants must notify the FTC within 14 days of any changes to designated contact points or structural changes that may affect compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Bankruptcy Notice
provisions.summary: Defendants must notify the FTC within 14 days of filing any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements

Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 682; Safeguards Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to key personnel and future personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from all recipients.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, provide timely notices of structural changes or bankruptcy, ensure all sworn submissions comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, and route all submissions by email or overnight courier.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, interviewing affiliated personnel, and using undercover means, without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates on October 20, 2037, or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging any violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Furnishing Credit Information Prior to Communication with Consumer
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from furnishing any Debt information to a Consumer Reporting Agency before first communicating with the Consumer about the Debt and providing required FDCPA disclosures.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Deletion of Consumer Debts
provisions.summary: The Corporate Defendant and Brandon M. Tumber must, within 10 days of entry of this Order, request that each CRA delete all Debts previously reported by Defendants from consumers' credit files.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unlawful Debt Collection Practices
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from using false or deceptive representations, unfair or unconscionable means, failing to provide required FDCPA notices, and violating any provision of the FDCPA in connection with Debt Collection Activities.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations Regarding Any Good or Service
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting that consumers have a legal obligation to pay Defendants, from communicating false credit information, or misrepresenting any material fact about any good or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unsubstantiated Claims
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from representing that a consumer owes a debt without competent and reliable substantiating evidence, and must cease collection and investigate or report disputes within required timeframes after a consumer denies or disputes a debt.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disclosure of Inaccurate Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from furnishing information about a consumer to any CRA while knowing or having reason to believe the information is inaccurate.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Violations of Furnisher Rule
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from violating the CFPB Furnisher Rule (12 C.F.R. § 1022.42–.43), including failing to establish written accuracy/integrity policies and procedures, failing to investigate FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes, and failing to report investigation results timely.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Equitable Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: A $24,300,000 judgment is entered against Defendants jointly and severally; Individual Defendants must assign payment rights from separation agreements to the Commission; specific cash payments and asset divestitures are required; remainder of judgment is suspended upon completion of specified payments, subject to reinstatement for financial misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants relinquish all rights to transferred assets; complaint facts may be taken as true in future litigation; Defendants must provide Taxpayer Identification Numbers; all Commission-received funds may be used for consumer redress or equitable relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from failing to provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to administer consumer redress, and must respond to written Commission requests for redress-related information within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Defendants must fully cooperate with Commission representatives in this case and related investigations, providing truthful information and appearing for proceedings upon 5 days written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within 7 days, deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, employees, and agents within specified timeframes for 5 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a sworn annual compliance report one year after entry of the Order, and for 10 years must submit sworn notices within 14 days of any changes to contact information, business structure, or bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create specified records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through written requests for reports and documents (responded to within 14 days), depositions, direct communications with Defendants and employees, undercover methods, and CRA-furnished consumer reports on Individual Defendants.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 57b; Section 814 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §1692l; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Bond Requirements for Unsolicited Commercial E-mail
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from sending Unsolicited Commercial E-mail unless he first obtains a $1,000,000 performance bond, subject to specific terms regarding duration, surety, notice, and disclosure.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Against TILA and Regulation Z Violations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from violating TILA and/or Regulation Z in connection with any advertisement promoting consumer credit extensions, including advertising inaccurate credit terms, rates, payment rates, or repayment periods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violations of Subtitle B of Title V of the GLB Act
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from violating or assisting others in violating Subtitle B of Title V of the GLB Act, including obtaining or attempting to obtain customer information of a financial institution through false, fictitious, or fraudulent statements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, business inspections, discovery, undercover posing as consumers or suppliers, and interviews of personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must notify the Commission of changes in residence, employment, name, and corporate structure; and must submit a sworn written compliance report 180 days after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry of the Order, Defendant must create and retain accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints/refund requests, and all sales/marketing materials for any qualifying business he owns or controls.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to relevant employees, principals, officers, directors, and managers of qualifying businesses and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receiving it.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Monitoring Compliance of Sales Personnel
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from failing to take reasonable steps to monitor sales personnel compliance, failing to investigate consumer complaints, and failing to take corrective action against non-compliant salespersons.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Prohibitions Involving Consumer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from selling, renting, transferring, or otherwise disclosing personal identifying information of any person who submitted information to 30 Minute Mortgage Inc., and from benefiting from or using such information obtained as a result of the activities alleged in the complaint.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Fees and Costs
provisions.summary: Each party agrees to bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Entry of This Judgment
provisions.summary: The Court orders immediate entry of this judgment by the Clerk, finding no just reason for delay.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with supervisory responsibilities, within 30 days of service for current personnel and within 30 days of assuming a position for future personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days before any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this order, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address changes; if notice is not possible 30 days in advance, notification must be as soon as practicable.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days of service and at such other times as the FTC may require, including a copy of the initial biennial Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order terminates on December 14, 2025, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of the order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery

provisions.title: Employment Notification — Respondent Stiles
provisions.summary: Respondent Stiles must notify the FTC within the required period of any discontinuance of her current business or employment, or any new affiliation with a business providing financial products or services, for a period of ten years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. provisions.title: Order Duration

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Covered Information and Consumer Emails
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner how it accesses, collects, uses, stores, or shares Covered Information or Consumer Emails in connection with any Covered Product.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Required Notification About Consumer Email Access
provisions.summary: Respondent must directly notify all active Covered Consumers whose email purchase receipts are accessed for market research, by sending a specific email within 10 days of the Order's entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Required Deletion of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete all stored email purchase receipts and associated Covered Information collected from Covered Consumers who enrolled prior to June 1, 2017, within 10 days of the Order's entry, unless the consumer provides affirmative express consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order to the Commission and deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel, then collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's issuance, submit timely notices of any material changes in contact information or corporate structure, and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specific business, personnel, consumer complaint, user-interface, and compliance records for prescribed periods of up to 10 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, interviewing affiliated personnel, and using undercover methods, including posing as consumers or suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order becomes final upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date a federal court complaint alleging a violation is filed, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from making consumer reports containing obsolete adverse information (civil suits, judgments, arrests over 7 years old, or other adverse items over 7 years old) and from failing to maintain reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)
