provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial compliance report one year after the Order, and timely notices of changes in contact information, organizational structure, or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for twenty years after the Order issuance date and retain each record for five years, unless otherwise specified.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates on December 22, 2041, or twenty years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities (Fair Credit Reporting Act)
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from failing to maintain FCRA-required procedures and from furnishing consumer reports to persons without a permissible purpose.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Fair Credit Reporting Act Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive monitoring program to regularly assess FCRA applicability and compliance before advertising or offering Covered Information for sale.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations to Consumers
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting, expressly or by implication, what users can achieve with the service, payment or cancellation terms, company policies, the likelihood a consumer has Covered Records, or any other material fact regarding Covered Records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unsubstantiated Representations Regarding Covered Records
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from stating that a consumer may have, does have, or that there are possible Covered Records, unless the representation is non-misleading and Defendants have actually found a Covered Record about that consumer from a third-party source.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Statements Regarding Traffic Tickets
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from stating, directly or by implication, that a traffic ticket or traffic citation is a criminal or arrest record.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Ban on Negative Options
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from advertising, marketing, promoting, or offering for sale any product or service with a Negative Option Feature.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Monetary Judgments and Partial Suspensions
provisions.summary: Establishes monetary judgments against Corporate Defendant ($28,945,968) and Individual Defendant ($5,000,000), with payment schedules totaling $16,000,000 and $5,000,000 respectively, secured by a deed of trust on Individual Defendant's property; specifies conditions for suspension, reinstatement, and default.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Establishes ancillary monetary terms including relinquishment of asset claims, use of complaint facts in future proceedings, nondischargeability provisions, taxpayer ID submission, use of collected funds for consumer redress, and obligation to provide customer information for redress administration.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendants must provide specified MyLife customer information to the Commission within 14 days and are permanently enjoined from disclosing or benefitting from customer information obtained prior to the Order, except for current customers if Defendants comply with Sections I–VI.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit sworn acknowledgments of receipt of the Order and deliver copies to principals, employees, agents, and third-party data providers, obtaining signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit annual compliance reports to the Commission sworn under penalty of perjury, report material changes within 14 days, report bankruptcy filings within 14 days, and annually submit FCRA monitoring program documentation for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create and retain specified records for 20 years after entry of the Order, retaining each record for five years, covering accounting, personnel, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, training materials, and compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Annual Certifications
provisions.summary: Starting one year after issuance, Individual Defendant and Corporate Defendant must each annually certify to the Commission that Order requirements have been established, implemented, and maintained, and that no uncorrected or undisclosed material noncompliance exists.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through written requests for reports, depositions, document production, direct communications with Defendants' personnel, and undercover methods including posing as consumers or suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities — Identity Theft Prevention Program
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to establish and maintain a written Identity Theft Prevention Program designed to detect, prevent, and mitigate identity theft in connection with Covered Accounts under the Red Flags Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Prohibited Business Activities — Consumer Reports and Debt
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from obtaining Consumer Reports without permissible purpose, selling or transferring debt on accounts where White Paging or Impermissible Co-Signing occurred, and furnishing information about such debt to CRAs.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Customer Service Task Force
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of entry of the Order, Defendant must establish and maintain for five years a Customer Service Task Force Program with specific procedures for verifying account identities, handling identity theft notices, investigating claims, and remedying illegitimate debts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Third Party Assessment
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its compliance with Provisions I–IV from a qualified, independent Assessor, covering defined reporting periods, and submit assessments to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with the Assessor by providing all relevant information and materials and not misrepresenting any material facts during any Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Oversight Requirement — Chief Compliance Officer
provisions.summary: Defendant must employ a Chief Compliance Officer who reports to the Board's Audit Committee and provides quarterly compliance reports to the Board on FCRA and identity theft risk management obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: For twenty years beginning one year after the Order's issuance, Defendant must annually provide the Commission with a sworn certification from its CEO or designated senior officer confirming compliance with Provisions I–IV and disclosure of any material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: A civil penalty judgment of $15,000,000 is entered against Defendant, which must be paid to the U.S. Treasury within seven days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Fund
provisions.summary: A $5,000,000 equitable monetary relief judgment is entered against Defendant, to be paid within seven days to the U.S. Treasury and administered by the Commission for consumer redress.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to assets transferred under the Order, Complaint facts may be taken as true in future proceedings, and Defendant's Taxpayer Identification Number may be used for reporting delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to provide sufficient customer information requested by the Commission to administer consumer redress, and must respond to written requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within seven days, deliver copies to principals, officers, relevant employees, and agents, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after entry of the Order, provide sworn notices of material changes within 14 days for ten years, notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and follow prescribed submission formats and delivery methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for ten years after entry of the Order and retain each record for five years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, employee training materials, and all compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through written requests for reports and documents (within 14 days), depositions, direct communications with Defendant, employee interviews, and all other lawful means including undercover contacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)
